titleStmt.title: James R. Page to James R. Dupuy
CWG1149

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Governor's Official Correspondence File, Requisitions for the Return of Fugitives from Justice, 1863-1867

body.p:
Commonwealth of Kentucky,
OFFICE OF SECRETARY OF STATE,
Frankfort, 8 Dec, 1865
J R. Dupuy Esqr
Louisville Ky
Dr Sir

Enclosed find Requisition as you required before Governor can offer a reward for fugitives, the Statutes require a petition from the Circuit or County Judge see page 374, Sec 22, Vol 1, Stantons Revised Statutes, as soon as petition is recd. the Governor will offer a reward.

Yrs Respectfully
Jas R. Page
Asst Secty
We respectfully suggest that his excellency offer a reward for Squire Cable Joseph Woods and Ben Woods for the murder of Joseph Norton in Jefferson county June 1865

J R Dupuy
George W. Johnston
Judge 7th Judicial
District of Ky.

Louisville Ky
Dec 21. 1863
Jas R Page Esqr
Asst secty of state
Dr Sir

Meeting Judge Johnson in the street accidentally must be my apology for preferring his request on the same sheet of paper on which your letter is. I dont know what could have been in my head to neglect getting his signature to the request except that perhaps I was in great haste or some thing of the sort I refer you to my other letter to you on the subject for any necessary particulars
Reward of $750, for Squire Cable, Joseph & Ben Woods for the murder of Jos Norton Jefferson Co. offered 26th Dec 1865
